body: I took that syntax from https://bnd.bndtools.org/chapters/170-versioning.html. Is that not officially supported by OSGi?

That syntax is a Bnd idiom (which is not working here which I will investigate for a fix to the next Bnd release) which Bnd should map to a proper version range. OSGi does not directly support those Bnd idioms.

So you can either directly code the upper limit to `5` since JUnit 4 should, by definition, not use the major version 5 since that belongs to JUnit 5. 

`version="[${Versions.junit4Min},5)"`

Or you can use the Bnd `range` macro to compute the upper limit 5:

`version="${'$'}{range;[==,+);${Versions.junit4Min}}"`

This uses `${'$'}` to stop Kotlin string interpolation from interpreting `${range` so that Bnd can process it as the `range` macro. https://bnd.bndtools.org/macros/range.html

There is also the question of why the resolve check did not catch this issue. @rotty3000 said he will investigate that.
The first fix looks much more readable. Would you mind submitting that as a PR?

issue.title: Bad version range in Import-Package

body: @bjhargrave @rotty3000 Thanks again for reporting and fixing! Could you please test with a snapshot version once CI has published?
Since the new test you added is green, I feel confident enough to release 5.6 GA without another feedback from your side. 🤞
